instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Chargers cables turning yellow - make them white again
threads.message:
Hi all,

A small contribution to limiting the amount of e-waste due to cosmetic reasons…

And since I did not find a single forum where they mention the below, I thought it would be interesting to post it here:

I had multiple chargers for Macbooks that turned yellow nearby the connector. For cosmetic reasons no one was interested and they piled up, to the point I wanted to recycle them.

But, I left one out in the sun on my terras during 2 hours and I noticed it got white again.
I “bleached” my stock this way.

Attached you can see the effect of one side in the sun for 2 hours and the original yellow other side.

I do not know how long this patch works, but seems stable after 3 weeks.

So get out, get some sun and take your chargers with you!

Esmon

[ATTACH type="full"]60662[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60663[/ATTACH]
